page_content:
*Choose to study computer science*.
Computer science is a field of knowledge that is developing rapidly in the modern world, and the profession of computer science is one of the most sought-after and profitable on the job market. It is referred to as the profession of the future.
*... at the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science of the Nicolaus Copernicus University*.
* *I degree* (3-year bachelor's degree and 3.5-year engineering degree).
* *II degree* (master's degree).

* *We teach:*.
	* practical use of IT tools.
	* programming in languages and environments used in IT practice.
	* administration of medium-sized information systems

* * We combine theoretical and practical classes.
	* in the third year of study, students create an *advanced team programming project* (as part of the subject Team Programming); earlier, in the first two years of study, they prepare for this theoretically and practically
	* group supervisors are specialists from UMK and *external IT companies*.
	* the project can form the basis of a thesis (for engineering studies)
	* authors of the best projects receive an award from the Dean of the Faculty of Mathematics and Computer Science at UMK

The student team for the winning project in the academic year 2013/14, , "Program Z12- an application streamlining the process of preparation and preliminary processing of results of public statistics" which is the result of successful cooperation with the Statistical Office in Bydgoszcz, won the *Prize of the Minister of Administration and Digitization* in the field of "The best presentation in the field of informatization of public administration" and the Main Prize of the Program Council of the ICT Forum and the National Inter-University Seminar entitled. "Research and design problems of state informatization" in the field of "Best substantive presentation" in the competition "Forum of Young Champions- economic aspects of state informatization" organized within the framework of the "XX ICT Forum".
In the 2016/2017 academic year, the Mayor of the City of Toruń awarded prizes to two teams of computer science students. One for an application that facilitates placing and processing orders in restaurants, and the other for an application that facilitates organizing bicycle tours.
* The *Faculty Computer System*.
	* is among the best at Polish universities.
	* is almost entirely based on gigabit network infrastructure.
	* it includes:
		* 3 server centers operating under the control of systems: Linux, FreeBSD and Windows 2008/2012 Server.
		* public-access computer workstations in the student project lab (8 workstations) and an extensive radio network that covers the entire building.
		* 21 teaching laboratories (256 workstations), including:
			* Mobile Technology Laboratory (Apple iOS, Android, Windows Phone) - a total of 3 laboratories.
			* specialized graphics and multimedia lab.
			* hardware lab ("Cisco").
			* specialized electronics and metrology lab.

* *For those who are willing:* *.
	* opportunity to participate in the administration of the Department's computer system!
	* participation in running departmental events (link: https://www.mat.umk.pl/web/wmii/torunski-festiwal-nauki-i-sztuki-2017) organized within the framework of the Toruń Festival of Science and Arts (link: http://www.festiwal.torun.pl/) (volunteering). Check out the video!

* *A graduate*.
	* has general IT knowledge and is familiar with the latest technologies.
	* is prepared for rapid knowledge acquisition and professional development.

* *After graduating with a degree in computer science, you will find work as:* *.
	* administrator of computer systems and networks
	* mobile application programmer
	* web application programmer
	* programmer
	* software engineer
	* database systems designer or analyst
	* decision-making systems designer
	* consultant in the field of complex informatization of enterprises
	* information systems implementer

Degree plan for computer science (link: https://www.mat.umk.pl/web/wmii/studia/informatyka)
